intro: Bupleurum petrogenes, commonly known as the mountain thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties. Bupleurum petrogenes is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its delicate foliage and showy blooms.
